result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tristin Sean Towsley

records.addlTxt:
2:08 PM 
Defendant Tristin Sean Towsley appeared by video from Waupun Correctional Institution.  Attorney Adam Thomas Witt in court for Tristin Sean Towsley.  Attorney Jenna L Gill in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives his right to in person appearance for purposes of sentencing today.
State informs the we cannot go forward with sentencing today re: victim compliance
Attorney Witt Informs the court this matter is resolved and the plea questionnaire and waiver of rights has been filed with the court.
Defendant enters plea of "GUILTY"  - Count 1.
Court questions defendant re: his plea and waiver of rights.
Court questions attorney Witt re: his clients plea and waiver of rights.
Defendant is advised of their voting rights.
Court finds plea and waiver is made freely, voluntarily, and intelligently.
Court accepts plea and finds the defendant "GUILTY".
Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Sentencing hearing on November 22, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Scheduling conference on October 24, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact with Victim 1.  Contact includes: contact at petitioner home, work, school, public places, in person, by phone, in writing, by electronic communication or device, or in any other manner.

3:45 PM Defendant Tristin Sean Towsley appeared by video.  Victim appeared by video.  Attorney Jenna L Gill in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Adam Thomas Witt in court for Tristin Sean Towsley. 

Atty Witt and defendant acknowledge receipt of complaint.
Court reads charging portion of complaint into the record and finds probable cause is stated for filing.
State requests $2,000 signature with conditions:
- no contact with victim 1
No objection by Atty Witt.
Court orders $2,000.00 signature bond with condition: no contact with victim 1.
Atty Witt informs Court that defendant wishes to waive preliminary hearing and proceed to arraignment.
Court questions defendant re: his waiver of preliminary hearing.
Court also questions Atty Witt re: his client's waiver of preliminary.
Court finds waiver of preliminary is made freely, knowingly and voluntarily; binds defendant over for arraignment.
"NOT GUILTY" pleas entered on all counts.
Set for scheduling conference 10/24/22 at 2:00 p.m.

3:01 PM 
Attorney Jenna L Gill in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Adam Thomas Witt in court for Tristin Sean Towsley . 
Attorney Witt informs the court status of this case and moves to continue.
Initial appearance scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Initial appearance on August 16, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Initial appearance on June 21, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

01:54 PM
 Attorney Jenna L Gill in court for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin. Prosecuting Atty Jenna L Gill appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Adam Thomas Witt in court for Defendant Tristin Sean Towsley. 
State moves to continue to a later date.  Initial appearance scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Return on warrant on May 17, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
